description.narrative: This investment is set up for the re-design of the Australia-China Human Rights Technical Cooperation (HRTC) Program 2017-21. The re-design process commenced in late 2016. The Investment Design Document (IDD) for the HRTC 2017-21 was approved on May 2017. It was agreed that the Australian Human Rights Commission (AHRC) was the best suited partner to meet the needs of the investment. The HRTC (2017-21) is a four-year, $8 million initiative aiming to support human rights reform in China. The ultimate and overarching purpose of the program is to contribute to human rights reform in China. The goal is for Australia and China to collaborate on shared priorities to advance human rights reform in China and apply human rights principles and practices. The end-of-program outcomes are: 1) Duty bearers, rights holders and advocates have an increased understanding and change in attitudes of human rights principles and practices; 2) Laws, regulations, policies and practices reflecting human righ
